title: Laws About Skin Diseases
summary: Leviticus 13 details how priests are to diagnose and manage infectious skin diseases (often translated as leprosy). It also covers mold in clothing and guidelines for declaring someone clean or unclean.

faq.question: Who examined people for skin diseases?
faq.answer: The priests, who acted as health inspectors and spiritual mediators.

faq.question: What happened if someone was declared unclean?
faq.answer: They had to live outside the camp and follow isolation practices.
